segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: Good news: the new React beta docs will be available soon! A link on the old doc invites to visit the new beta site. Gatsby v5 released alpha.
segments.sourceMdx: Good news: the new React beta docs will be available soon! A link on the old doc invites to visit the new beta site. Gatsby v5 released alpha.

segments.content: The current trend: bringing reactivity to React.
segments.sourceMdx: The current trend: bringing reactivity to React.

segments.content: Some nice React-Native content too. We are watching closely the progress of Expo Router, WishList and web support in Reassure.
segments.sourceMdx: Some nice React-Native content too. We are watching closely the progress of Expo Router, WishList and web support in Reassure.

segments.content: TypeScript celebrates its 10th anniversary. A `--watch` mode is coming in Node.js. Interesting content about WebAssembly.
segments.sourceMdx: TypeScript celebrates its 10th anniversary. A `--watch` mode is coming in Node.js. Interesting content about WebAssembly.

segments.content: ## âš›ï¸ React
segments.sourceMdx: ## âš›ï¸ React {#react}

segments.content: **[Gatsby v5 Alpha](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-v5-alpha-is-here-and-its-pretty-exciting/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Gatsby v5 Alpha](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-v5-alpha-is-here-and-its-pretty-exciting/)**

segments.content: The v5 of Gatsby is in alpha with 2 main new features:
segments.sourceMdx: The v5 of Gatsby is in alpha with 2 main new features:

segments.content:
* support for [partial hydration](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/a-look-at-partial-hydration-in-gatsby-5/) based on React Server Components and a `"client export"` directive at the top of client components
* the Gatsby Slices API, which allows to significantly improve build times when a shared component (layout/navbar/footer) should be re-rendered
segments.sourceMdx:
- support for [partial hydration](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/a-look-at-partial-hydration-in-gatsby-5/) based on React Server Components and a `"client export"` directive at the top of client components
- the Gatsby Slices API, which allows to significantly improve build times when a shared component (layout/navbar/footer) should be re-rendered

segments.content: **[Making React fast by default and truly reactive](https://legendapp.com/open-source/legend-state/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Making React fast by default and truly reactive](https://legendapp.com/open-source/legend-state/)**

segments.content: Interactive article that illustrates the problems of re-rendering in React which is not optimized by default. Shows how the Legend-State library, based on observables, allows to bring reactivity to React (a bit like SolidJS). The code is then optimized by default and avoids unnecessary re-renders.
segments.sourceMdx: Interactive article that illustrates the problems of re-rendering in React which is not optimized by default. Shows how the Legend-State library, based on observables, allows to bring reactivity to React (a bit like SolidJS). The code is then optimized by default and avoids unnecessary re-renders.

segments.content: **[Ezno - Experimental compiler](https://kaleidawave.github.io/posts/introducing-ezno/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Ezno - Experimental compiler](https://kaleidawave.github.io/posts/introducing-ezno/)**

segments.content: A new experimental type-checking compiler for JavaScript, compatible with TypeScript annotations and JSX. Relies on dependent typing to do advanced static analysis and pre-evaluations at compile-time (reminds [prepack](https://prepack.io/)). The goal seems to be to be able to compile an app that looks like React in a reactive form, and skip the VDOM. Quite technical to read.
segments.sourceMdx: A new experimental type-checking compiler for JavaScript, compatible with TypeScript annotations and JSX. Relies on dependent typing to do advanced static analysis and pre-evaluations at compile-time (reminds [prepack](https://prepack.io/)). The goal seems to be to be able to compile an app that looks like React in a reactive form, and skip the VDOM. Quite technical to read.

segments.content: **[(Lazy) Components Maps](https://julesblom.com/writing/lazy-component-maps)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[(Lazy) Components Maps](https://julesblom.com/writing/lazy-component-maps)**

segments.content: Presents a useful technique to know to leverage code-splitting when you do conditional rendering. Especially useful on large enums/union-types, such as an `<Icon name="my-icon-name"/>` component.
segments.sourceMdx: Presents a useful technique to know to leverage code-splitting when you do conditional rendering. Especially useful on large enums/union-types, such as an `<Icon name="my-icon-name"/>` component.

segments.content: **[Whyframe](https://whyframe.dev/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Whyframe](https://whyframe.dev/)**

segments.content: Allows frontend component rendering to be isolated in an iframe. Now supports [Webpack, Next.js and Docusaurus](https://twitter.com/bluwyoo/status/1576947013450539008). This seems handy for component library documentation sites, ensuring the global CSS of the site does not affect the rendering of the component displayed.
segments.sourceMdx: Allows frontend component rendering to be isolated in an iframe. Now supports [Webpack, Next.js and Docusaurus](https://twitter.com/bluwyoo/status/1576947013450539008). This seems handy for component library documentation sites, ensuring the global CSS of the site does not affect the rendering of the component displayed.

segments.content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native
segments.sourceMdx: ## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}

segments.content: **[Reassure - Continuous App Performance Monitoring Made Simple](https://www.callstack.com/blog/app-performance-monitoring)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Reassure - Continuous App Performance Monitoring Made Simple](https://www.callstack.com/blog/app-performance-monitoring)**

segments.content: Callstack estimates 80% of performance problems on React-Native come from JS, and in particular from React misuse. They created Reassure, a new performance regression testing library. It integrates well with your CI to prevent the performance of your apps from degrading over time. The [web support](https://github.com/callstack/reassure/issues/39) is not yet available.
segments.sourceMdx: Callstack estimates 80% of performance problems on React-Native come from JS, and in particular from React misuse. They created Reassure, a new performance regression testing library. It integrates well with your CI to prevent the performance of your apps from degrading over time. The [web support](https://github.com/callstack/reassure/issues/39) is not yet available.

segments.sourceMdx: ## ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Jobs {#jobs}

segments.content: ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied\&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)
segments.sourceMdx: ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)

segments.content: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.
segments.sourceMdx: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.

segments.content: ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20\&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)
segments.sourceMdx: ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)

segments.content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is \~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe\_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.
